Anyway, in lieu of that, I tried to mainly focus on positives and not get hung up over minor details like lack of flavor and all that junk.

Food is very fresh, servers are very nice, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is soothing. My dad and I ordered the Panang Curry and OMG was it good!! The coconut milk-based sauce was rich and flavorful with just the right amount of spice and hint of sweetness. The chicken used in the dish was very fresh, had great texture, and was primarily lean, white meat. The vegetables included in the dish had just the right amount of crispness to it which is a great indicator that the veggies they use are fresh! Overall, I left the restaurant with a satisfied tummy :)

My daughter and I visited on a Saturday night. The service was friendly and fast and our meals were delicious! We shared a spring roll and house salad. The ingredients were fresh. We both had the colorful vegetable entrees one with shrimp and one with chicken. The vegetables were fresh and crisp and the meats enhanced the dishes.  We enjoyed our visit to Thailicious and look forward to dining there again.

First time coming here, very tasty! I am a huge fan of green curry, it was an amazing spice and the veggies were very fresh. My husband had the drunken noodles, also very good. The only thing I would say is that the AC was on, it was very cold in the restaurant, but the tea and food definitely made it!!

Just delicious Thai food.  They turned me into a Thai food addict.  The only problem I have with this place is their hours, why can't they be open 24/7?!  I always have order take out so I cannot speak for their eat in service but delivery and take out are GREAT and their food is just PERFECTLY DELICIOUS!

The go to Thai restaurant now has a cool sounding name.  Come on people -- Thailicious.  Thailicious has all of the standard fare in varying degrees of spiciness.  We usually order our food to go.  I can attest to the Green Curry and Drunken Noodles being good.  The location is in a strip mall with ample parking near Walgreens and Fresh and Easy.
Very good thai food!!  Service is good, restaurant is nicely decorated with fun modern decor and I love the bathroom!!

Friendly greeting, prompt service. Had Penang Curry that was excellent with a creamy coconut milk soup, fresh tender chicken and super crispy veggies that were cooked just enough. Price is very reasonable. This entry compares very favorably to Thai places in my home base of San Francisco and I would say is better than many places in SF.

We ordered pad thai and colorful vegetables with beef. Both were delicious, but the pad thai didn't taste like pad thai really. I would eat it again though. It just had a different taste. What was the best was the Thai sticky rice with mango. Oh my God I will dream about that dessert!!!!!! It did not sound that appealing to me (my family member picked it out), but it was soooo good!  Also love that you can order online!

Was craving Thai food.... yelped to see what was close to home and stumbled upon this location. Went in to do a take out order at 8pmish, hostess was very nice and friendly and helped me pick out an appetizer. Ordered the pad Thai with chicken (not spicy) and was SUPER flavorful!  Ordered the pad Thai with beef spicy for my other half- he'd never had Thai food before and was very impressed!  Also ordered the sticky rice with mango and it was delicious. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to get their Thai fix :)

Went out for lunch today with my friends, two of us had never been there before. We were seated fast and the waitress didn't take long to come and get our orders. The food came out fast. The only thing that kind of bugged me is that the waitress didn't leave us a pitcher or water nor did she refill our drinks. Other than that food was good and service was fast. :)
This place had amazing service.  Do you understand how hard that is to come by in an asian restaurant?  Do yourself a favor and get the curry

We were craving Thai food but didn't feel like driving far so we ended up here. It was delicious! The drunken noodles had a hint of sweetness and the garlic lovers had a great flavor! The atmosphere was very inviting and the service was great. We will definitely be back!
The place is clean and service is prompt. Love the drunken noodles and have it served Thai Spicy. Sooo good. Soup and salad bar are yummy and the peanut sauce/ dressing is to die for.

I know we ordered our take out a bit late of the evening and was 40 minutes close to closing time so I will have to go back and try it again. My BF ordered Garlic Lover Chicken (medium). It was lacking in flavor - lots of kick to it but it needed more garlic, pepper, salt - very blend. My Chrispy Thai Roll was not cooked properly - it could have been cooked a couple of minutes more. So that was disappointing. The highlight for that night was the Thailicious Dumplings! That was flavored well and it was delightful to have. Next time we go, we'll have to try other things but will definitely be ordering the Dumplings again. The restaurant itself is very quaint. Love how clean and nice the place looked.
Good menu and the food was very tasty! The dumplings were great ! However, service was merely ok. Not sure is the best value for the money.
Ate here while visiting my parents and all three of the dishes we got were good, fresh and clean. Will have to come back next time I visit!

Surpisingly good, I don't expect much from asian restaurants in AZ as they don't compare to the asian food in CA. I have experienced disappointment repeatedly in AZ to the point of apathy, but was pleasantly surprised when I came across this restaurant. A pearl in the small sea of mediocre asian restaurants in AZ.    Notable dishes we ordered were the shrimp cakes as appetizers, pad thai and pineapple fried rice for entrees, and sticky rice with mango for dessert. Dessert was delicious! Of all the sticky rice w/ mangos I have had this beats the rest, the only disappointment was the portion size, a little overpriced. Those are the must try dishes! I definitely will stop by again even if its a bit far for me, so worth it when you are craving good Thai food!
Went for lunch. Good food for reasonable price. My friend didn't like to serve himself soup and salad. I really liked the peanut salad dressing
I am so glad we chose this restaurant for my birthday. Excellent food and great service. The entree  portion's were very generous. I will be back again!!

Almost 4 stars. $16.99 for curry duck with full leg and breast slices. Yellow coconut curry with basel, leaks, red peppers potato etc accompanied by an array of chili sauces and dry chili. The sauce was amazing. You can order it at any spice level. Also had Thai iced coffee. The place is clean!  Staff is friendly. Service was good. The duck unfortunately must have been sitting around forever. Not tender. Dry. I thinking it was cooked yesterday and warmed up, that was disappointing.

Came here to try their lunch special. For 8.99 you can get soup & salad and your choice of entrees that include curries or pan fried noodles. I had to order my standard pad thai. on the lunch menu. The Pad Thai was a bit too sweet. Their Drunken noodles are a better choice with fragrant thai basil. The salad that day was simple but had a nice peanut  sauce. Soup was a sweet and sour soup. Thai tea here was good. Overall, a nice choice for a quick lunch.

First time here tonight, but will definitely return.  EVERYTHING was delicious! The service was great, the atmosphere relaxed; and did I mention the food was perfect? A must try for anyone looking for great Thai.

In honor of my YFF being today's ROTD holder, I declare an end to my review hiatus.  Thailicious has sat motionless in my bookmarks for months, ever since mon ami Kristin J first alerted me to its existence.  The name alone evokes images of "superlicious delish", as the superlicious Mary A states.  The characters in this screenplay are as follows... Joyce W - my YFF and international essay contest winner, who I shall refer to as J-WoW.  If you want to read an actual well written review, check hers out. Linh L - one of today's top talents in beat-boxing, who I shall refer to as Mr Peanut.  If you want to read an actual amusing review, check his out. Brett B - the author of this autobiography, who I shall also refer to as Mr Peanut The Waitress - who I shall refer to as Flo  As an author, whose responsibility it is to convey an experience to you, the reader, I hope you'll be able to take away this... I arrived AND checked in prior to either J-WoW or Mr Peanut!  After 'handshakes & hugs', we gangsta strolled up into that beyaaaa...ah.  What a sight it must have been.  Two of us could have passed for cast members from the Asian version of Melrose Place, while the third closely resembled Zippy the pinhead.  We were promptly ushered to a booth with what appeared to be vinyl seats, and I make this distinction to inform the reader that as I scootched myself across the bench, an inopportune vibration was simulcast from the vicinity of my pants bottom.  Not wanting to appear like a wind-talker in front of my co-diners, I made an effort to replicate the sound by continuing my side-glide until successive audible vinyl rubs were rendered.  But no such vindication was attained...  My companions were a true delight.  Dear reader, may you be blessed with your own J-WoWs and Mr Peanuts.  Lunch doesn't always have to just be about binging on 1800 calorie entrees.  Open your heart, and your heart may just open you back.  I ordered the Pad See Ew, vegetarian style as a nod to my girl Cici F.  Now, I'm down with PSE, yeah, you know me.  It's my jam.  The dish gets my merkin a twerkin... however this one didn't have the je ne sais quoi of Thai Spices or Thai Rama, but that didn't dissuade me from a raucous display in which no less than half of the deadly sins were involved.  After putting in our dessert order, I asked Flo if she would be so kind as to provide me with a spoon, say... eighteen or nineteen inches in length.  Now here's the kicker.  She looked at me like I was a damned fool.  That delightful Thai Tea Creme Brulee dessert proved to be the meal's Swan Song. It boasted a sun kissed glow that could have passed for San Diego's own TM, a consistency smoother than my girl MC J, and was reminiscent of everything that's right about pumpkin pie without the benefits of high protein or dietary fiber.  How is no one singing its praises?  [Chorus - Nicki Minaj, J-Wow & Mr Peanut:] Flo, I got this short-azz spoon in my hand Beating like a drum on a treat that's all tanned Can't you taste that creme, bacreme, creme, creme, bacreme, bru, lee? You got that creme brulee creme, bacreme, creme, creme, bacreme, bru, lee Yeah, that's the creme brulee (Creme) [x15]  Side Note: If you enjoy leering at beautiful women from the shadows, as they make selections from a salad bar, then boy are you in luck!

We are here dinner with another couple. I got a steak meal and TL got a rice dish.   We went here not to long ago. I just remember that the food was "okay" usually when I like something I remember.   The food wasn't bad here or amazing, that's just me. So give it a try!

I have no idea how this place is so highly rated. It's average food, at best, and the service was one level below awful.   I came here for lunch and found my usual pad prik king, so I was excited to try their version of it. There weren't any tables available but there was some room at the bar.   The bartender (if you can call her that, since she spent probably an entire 60 seconds behind the bar the whole time I was in there) ignored me until I waived at which point she said "you ready?"  She took my order, didn't tell me about the salad / soup bar, and left. It was the last time she spoke to me. I actually had to flag another waitress to refill my water and bring the check. At least that waitress was pleasant and helpful.   The pad Prik sauce was too sweet and unbalanced. The soup wasn't great either. The salad dressing was really delicious, though.   They didn't give me one reason to come back, so I probably won't.

Best Thai food in Arizona, no question. This is as close to "LA Thai food" you will get and it does NOT EVER disappoint! Chicken or beef pad Thai is out of this world and their peanut sauce is the best I've ever had in my life.

I am very impressed with this place. I went with a friend after yoga last week (sorry Thailicious for our smellyness!) and we were a little wary since it hasn't been open long and when we entered it was mostly empty. Well, our wariness was unnecessary, this place was great. I asked the waitress what I should get between the noodle soup and the drunken noodles... she so delicately said.... ummm lots of.... white people... order drunken noodles. Ha!!! I ordered the noodle soup with beef at her suggestion. When the soup came out I was worried... it looked kind of gross... like brown water. Oh my god this soup was good. So flavorful, like a mix of a Thai soup and a pho. Tons and tons of flavor. I ate it all. I was planning on taking half home for lunch the next day. Uh oh. I ended up deciding to order another dish to go so I would have lunch the next day and got the drunken noodles. This portion was much larger than the soup, so I was able to eat it for two days. I will say, at a 4/5 star, it wasn't spicy. Also, though good, it didn't touch the flavor of the soup. I will come back here for that soup, so good!   Cons include - expensive for the portion size (can usually make at least two meals out of a 10$ bowl of soup, but not so here), the drunken noodles were not the best I have had, and they put a big mass of carrot strings on their noodles as garnish... don't really get this, why not put the carrot in the noodle mix? the carrot garnish was a little odd after heating the rest up the second day.

The Food I had ordered a pad thai here during lunch time. It came with salad and soup side bar which I did not get to take advantage of since the waitress did not tell me about it. The portion was a pretty good size I would have to say that it seemed a little bit smaller than Thai Basil. Nonetheless, the pad thai tasted delicious.    The Service I went a little after 12pm and it wasn't too busy, but the waitresses were not too responsive or just forgetful. I would try to ask them for straws or water  but it took them forever to get that to us after several reminders. Also, they did not tell us that the soup and salad was actually a sidebar; I figured that out myself as I left the restaurant.  Overall, their service was not great.   The Ambiance The design of the restaurant was really modern like a casual cafe. I thought it was a nice place to hangout with friends, go on a food date, or a family meal.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the valley!  My favorite is the the holy basil with chicken. It is so delicious!  My other favorite is their pumpkin curry!  If you see it on special, get it!  You won't be disappointed!  Their egg rolls are also amazing!  Always crunchy and never soggy!  Try it for lunch when you can also help yourself to their free soup and salad buffet. The peanut dressing for the salad is so good as is their sweet and sour soup!
Delivery We all have had the quality of our food minish when it is delivered.  Not the case with Thailicious.   Easily some of the best Thai food ever, the seafood was so fresh tasting, yum.

I decided to try this food on my day off at the house and was really disappointed with the outcome of the order.   I ordered about 50 dollars worth of food and of course a coke.  I saw that the coke on the menu from Grubhub was 2.50 or 3.00 I can't remember exactly and was expecting a 2 liter of coke. to my surprise I received a 12 oz can of coke. I tipped the driver 10 dollars and called the store back.   I was really upset with the lack of customer service and the lack of understanding and had to return the order. It was a lose lose for both parties and I would be careful ordering from this restaurant in fact I think that they stopped taking deliveries last night.

There has never been a time I have been to Thailicious and been disappointed.  I typically get the medium spice Pad Thai, but this last time I got their take on Pho.  It was delicious, hot (temperature and spice) and comforting.  It is also a nice quite restaurant and that is great when you don't want to be somewhere loud.  I highly recommend anyone to go here and enjoy the atmosphere and food.

#200:  It was an action-packed day!  Celebrating my 200th review on the day I just so happened to get ROTD made for a fun day with the boys!  What better way to celebrate than with a Thai Tea Creme Brulee that we've all been dying to try?  After a little while, our food arrived.  The Pad Thai was nothing extraordinary or spectacular but I enjoyed every bite.  I was really impressed by the portion given that it was lunch.  For $8, I got myself not only lunch but dinner!  I'm interested in seeing how big their dinner size is now.  Anyways, after nom noming for a good while, we were ready for the grand finale:  Thai Tea Creme Brulee!  It was probably a 10 minute wait before three Thai Tea Creme Brulees were placed before us.   Not wasting time, I gleefully grabbed my spoon and cracked the most beautiful caramel shell.  That first bite made fireworks go off in my head.  It was Chinese New Year and I had front-row seats on Victoria Harbour... which is weird because we're at a Thai restaurant and not Hong Kong... whatever!  This is my review so bite me.  Reminiscent of warm pumpkin pie in texture, it was creamy perfection!  It was smooth and the Thai tea flavor really hits you and it was delicious.    At $18-something a pop for beverages, lunch, and dessert, I definitely think Thailicious delivers.  Good portions, great atmosphere, and friendly service.  This place gets packed around noon so come prepared.

Solid Thai food!  I'm usually a "medium" type of person, but my friend got his Panang curry in the "hot" variety and it was not only still edible, it actually had good flavor.  We also had the green and massaman curries.  The only thing that keeps this from being a 4 star restaurant in my book was the service.  Our waitress was very polite but not the most friendly, and it was obvious that she had a huge workload (she seems to have been the only person taking care of every customer in the joint, and she was also working the cashier), but we did not receive any water refills during our stay (my friend jumped up and grabbed an additional pitcher from the counter for us when it became obvious that we wouldn't get another), and we weren't ever offered additional rice (we resorted to drinking the curries like soup). Fine but not ideal.  Still, not a bad place for some late-night food!

We stopped here on our way from the Phx airport to Tucson.  Unassuming restaurant in a strip, but don't let that stop you.  Delicious food. Huge flavor.  Great Thai ice tea.  I'd go back next time we were in the area.
This is hands down my favorite Thai spot in the metro Phoenix area. They make the best Thai tea and my favorite meal to get is the panang curry with shrimp and I love their fried rice.

Thailicious! Omg!! This food is delicious! I can't stop coming because it so good. I usually get the lunch chicken pad thai lunch menu comes with salad,egg roll and soup. Great customer service and food is fresh and amazing!

Updates: I haven't been back here for a while and was craving for Thai food again. I was looking forward to good food as well as saying hi to the owner, unfortunately she was very busy helping out in the kitchen when I got there. This place is a whole lot busier than the first few months when it was opened. Still clean. Still spacious. Everything is exactly the way I remember it.   Service: Service is still great. Even after the bill was paid, they still come by to check up on us and even offered to give us to go cup for more sodas. We politely turned it down but thought it was very nice.   Food: I ordered a Thai basil dish with beef and it wasn't as good as Basil fried rice. Beef doesn't have much flavor on it and I can hardly taste the basil flavor. We also ordered egg rolls and it was pretty decent.   Rating: Overall I still think it is a good Thai restaurant. I'll come back here again to try some other different dishes.
